blockinfo.om_all_outputs_off: Turns off all $t(generic.output)s of the installation. It is advised to wrap this in a separate $t(generic.groupaction), and use that one in a delayed set. This way, the action isn't triggerd by accident.
blockinfo.om_change_shutters: Controls a Shutter or group of Shutters. This will give better results compared to manually controlling shutters.
blockinfo.om_check_datetime:
Check/compare the day/time:
  • Hours are between 0 and 23
  • Minutes are between 0 and 59
  • The day of the week is between 1 and 7, starting on Monday
blockinfo.om_check_io_on: Checks if an $t(generic.intput)/$t(generic.output) is on or off.
blockinfo.om_check_sensor:
Check/compare the value of a sensor:
  • Temperature is a value between -32 to 95 degrees, in 0.5 degree steps
  • Brightness is a value between 0 and 254
  • Humidity is a value between 0 and 100, in 0.5% steps
blockinfo.om_check_validationbit: Check/compare the state of the entered validation bit (0-255).
blockinfo.om_delay: Delay the enclosed set of actions with a set amount of seconds.
blockinfo.om_delayed_set: A delayed set will execute all it's actions on release. When pressed for a short moment (less than 2 seconds), the main set of actions are executed. When held down longer (2 or more seconds), the connected $t(generic.groupaction)s will be executed one after the other.
blockinfo.om_fade: Fades a Dimmer up/down with a set amount of steps.
blockinfo.om_if: An if-block allows logical decisions. Add one or more checks, and make sure to add at least one then-statement. Else-statements are optional.
blockinfo.om_onoff_all_lights: Turns all $t(generic.light)s of the installation on/off. Use with care; a too high current drawn might trip the fuses.
blockinfo.om_onoff_floor: Turns all $t(generic.light)s of a given floor on/off.
blockinfo.om_output_on_with: Turns an $t(generic.output) on, in the mean time setting dimmer and timer value(s).
blockinfo.om_raw: Executes a Action Type. This advanced option allows use of Action Types not yet integrated in this interface.
blockinfo.om_send_event: Send an Event to installed plugins.
blockinfo.om_set_variable: Increases or decreases a variable (0-255) with a set amount, or set it to zero.
blockinfo.om_start: This is the start; link blocks to build a sequence of actions.
blockinfo.om_toggle_all_lights: Toggles all $t(generic.light)s of the installation. Use with care; a too high current drawn might trip the fuses.
blockinfo.om_toggle_floor: Toggles all $t(generic.light)s of a given floor.
blockinfo.om_toggle_follow: Toggles a group of $t(generic.output)s. The first $t(generic.output) will be toggled, and all subsequent $t(generic.output)s will get the state of the first one. This can be used to toggle a group of $t(generic.output)s that can also be toggled individually.
blockinfo.om_toggle_with: Toggle the configured $t(generic.output), setting the dimmer at a set level.

builder.delayset: Execute on $t(generic.input) release: %1 %2 Execute after pressing... %3 2 seconds: %4 3 seconds: %5 4 seconds: %6 5 seconds: %7 6 seconds: %8
builder.noblockinfo: Select a block to display some basic (help) information, if available.
builder.warnnotoggle: Should only contains "Toggle [$t(generic.output)]" statements. At least 2 such statements required.

actionerrors.noactions: No actions have been added yet.
actionerrors.toolong: Too many actions. Try reducing the actions by placing certain functionality in a separate $t(generic.groupaction).

cloud.generalinformation: It is possible to connect your OpenMotics system to the OpenMotics Cloud. This free-of-charge service adds additional features to the system;
cloud.metricsinformation: To be able to provide historical usage information on the Cloud, the system periodically sends usage information to the Cloud infrastructure. For example, it might send that a total of 3274 kWh electricity was used at 2017-04-23 at 15:45.

general.info: Please provide general settings for the Thermostats. The heating will active as soon as the linked sensor drops below the threshold.
general.invalidthreshold: Threshold should be between -32 and 95 degrees, in steps of 0.5
general.title: General

switching.info: This step allows the definition of certain $t(generic.output)s and values to be set when the Thermostat is switched from heating to cooling. This could for example be used to power on the airco units.
switching.title: Switching between heating and cooling

configure.feedbackinfo: Settings related to CAN LED feedback.
configure.lightsoff: An $t(generic.input) configured as 'All lights Off' does not need extra settings.
configure.motionsensorwarning: The motion sensor's pulse timeout should be shorter than the selected timeout above.
configure.noledsavailable: This $t(generic.output) has no feedback slots available anymore.
configure.otherfeedback: Other LED feedback linked to this $t(generic.output)
configure.title: Configuration

feedback.linkedinfo: This $t(generic.input) via CAN supports LED feedback. It can directly be controlled by an $t(generic.output), or it can be used to provide generic feedback (e.g. indicate whether one or more Lights are on).
feedback.title: LED feedback

general.advancedinfo: An $t(generic.input) can trigger a series of advanced actions.
general.groupactioninfo: Triggering this $t(generic.input) will execute a $t(generic.groupaction). This makes it easy to have multiple $t(generic.input)s to execute the same logic.
general.inactiveinfo: An $t(generic.input) is typically marked as 'Inactive' when it is not (yet) in use.
general.info: Please provide some general parameters for the $t(generic.input). The selected mode's settings will be configured in the next step(s).
general.lightsoffinfo: Pressing this $t(generic.input) will turn all lights off
general.linkedinfo: An $t(generic.input) can be directly linked to a given $t(generic.output). In this case, pressing the $t(generic.input) will toggle the $t(generic.output). In case the linked $t(generic.output) is dimmable, long pressing the $t(generic.input) will cause the $t(generic.output) to cycle through it's range.
general.motionsensorinfo: An $t(generic.input) can be controlled by a motion sensor. Each time motion is reported, a linked $t(generic.output) is turned on for a given amount of time.
general.name: Name
general.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 8 characters
general.outputsoffinfo: Pressing this $t(generic.input) will turn all $t(generic.output)s off
general.pulseinfo: An $t(generic.input) that is linked to a Pulse Counter can be used for energy measurement by pulse inputs (e.g. a gas or water meter).
general.title: General

configure.info: Please fill in all information of the Thermostat. For a thermostat to become used by the system, at least the Sensor and the primary $t(generic.output) must be configured
configure.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
configure.notusable: The entered information will result in a Thermostat that cannot be used by the system. Both a Sensor and the Primary $t(generic.output) must be specified.
configure.pump0invalid: Primary pump/kettle cannot be selected due to insufficient slots
configure.pump0novalve: Primary pump/kettle is already in use as a primary/secondary $t(generic.output) or vice versa
configure.pump1invalid: Secondary pump/kettle cannot be selected due to insufficient slots
configure.pump1novalve: Secondary pump/kettle is already in use as a primary/secondary $t(generic.output) or vice versa
configure.sameoutput: The primary and secondary $t(generic.output)s cannot be identical
configure.title: Configure Thermostat
configure.usedbyother0: The primary $t(generic.output)s is controled by another Thermostat
configure.usedbyother1: The secondary $t(generic.output)s is controled by another Thermostat

discover.beforecontinue: Please set the correct mode before continuing.
discover.info: Before the initialisation process is started please correctly configure any $t(generic.output) Modules:
discover.ledsnormal: All front panel LEDs blink: Normal mode
discover.ledsshutter: The LEDs of $t(generic.output)s 1, 3, 5 and 7 blink: Shutter mode
discover.normal: Normal mode: By default the $t(generic.output) Module can toggle up to 8 electrical circuits. If this is your intended use no action needs to be performed
discover.shutter: Roller Shutter mode: When in Roller Shutter mode the $t(generic.output) Module can control up to 4 electrical roller shutters (4x up & down)
discover.switch: To toggle between modes press the button next to the red programming connector on the $t(generic.output) module for 5 seconds:
discover.title: Module discover procedure

groupaction.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
